p: It is clear that our reported infection control protocol and improvements may not be directly applicable to other ICUs, as systems and processes should be specific to individual institutions and local practices. This report is limited in that the time constraints of an imminent outbreak did not allow a more formal evaluation of methodology, nor provide evidence that the intervention described improved actual practice, or contributed to the actual reduction of transmission to HCWs. Nevertheless, we believe in situ simulation provides a potentially useful tool to rehearse the safe care of patients in anticipation of treating an emerging infectious disease such as COVID-19.
